nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.glyphs

Class Glyph

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.glyphs.Glyph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrowStyle, PointStyle

    public abstract class Glyph
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic glyph class. Glyphs are used to tie a geometric representation to concepts that doesn't have one (or one not suitable for rendering). Glyphs provide a basic shape that can be used to represent these concepts. Moreover, it is possible to override the rendering context in one of number of ways.

    • Method Detail

      • getGlyphShape

        public abstract BaseGeometry getGlyphShape()
        Constructs the basic geometry for the glyph. The origin of this geometry should be (0,0).
        Returns:
        glyph representation

      • getFillMode

        public abstract GlyphFillMode getFillMode()
        Returns the desired way of filling the glyph (if at all).
        Returns:
        one of GlyphFillMode

      • getFillColor

        public java.awt.Color getFillColor()
        Override this method to change the fixed color for filling. Only has effect if getFillMode returns FIXED. Defaults to white if not overridden by subclass.
        Returns:
        the fixed color

      • getStrokeMode

        public abstract GlyphStrokeMode getStrokeMode()
        Returns the desired way of stroking the glyph (if at all).
        Returns:
        one of GlyphStrokeMode

      • getStrokeColor

        public java.awt.Color getStrokeColor()
        Override this method to change the fixed color for stroking. Only has effect if getStrokeMode returns FIXED. Defaults to black if not overridden by subclass.
        Returns:
        the fixed color

      • getStrokeWidthMode

        public abstract GlyphStrokeWidthMode getStrokeWidthMode()
        Returns the desired way of setting the strokewidth for the glyph. Only has effect if getStrokeMode does not return CLEAR.
        Returns:
        one of GlyphStrokeWidthMode

      • getStrokeWidth

        public double getStrokeWidth()
        Override this method to change the fixed strokewidth. Only has effect if getStrokeWidthMode returns FIXED. Defaults to 0.4 if not overridden by subclass.
        Returns:
        the fixed strokewidth
